name: parleying
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
present participle of
parley
to meet in order to discuss something, especially how to end an argument or a war: After some serious parleying, both sides agreed to settle their differences. He has led disarmament talks and parleyed with NATO.
More examplesFewer examplesThey parleyed in private for hours while aides anxiously waited outside the door.He parleyed with the enemy when truces were made. The clerks parleyed with the customer through small pigeonholes that could be promptly closed.
